newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Georgia bars Russian army planes over unpaid debts.
newsitem.headline: Georgia bars Russian army planes over unpaid debts.

text.p: Georgian air traffic controllers on Tuesday barred Russian military cargo planes, which supply Moscow's peacekeeping troops in the former Soviet republic, from flying in Georgian airspace, a Russian air force spokesman said.
Georgian authorities have asked Moscow to pay a $250,000 debt for air traffic services to military aircraft but could not say when the debt might be paid off.
"We don't know how and when the debt will be paid," the spokesman said.
Russian troops, which have been based in Georgia since a 1992 civil conflict with Abkhaz separatists, will not get food and other supplies -- normally amounting to 40 tonnes a week.

In Tbilisi, a Georgian civil aviation official confirmed that air traffic services for Russian military freighters had been stopped because of debts. -- Viktor Anoshkin, Moscow Newsroom, +7095 941 8520
